title.native: 東京リベンジャーズ 天竺編

description:
Adaptation of the Tenjiku Arc.

With a future where Toman has been destroyed by Mikey's twisted ideas and Takemichi returning to the past, he decides to become stronger in order to stop Kisaki's plans. On one side, a mysterious gang from Yokohama known as Tenjiku begins to overthrow all the Toman divisions, deciding to destroy all the gangs in Japan, becoming the most powerful and unique.

Kisaki has been planning something for his purposes against Toman, now that he is banned.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

node.description: Received a Young Magazine Newcomer Manga Award Honorable Mention for his _Shinjuku Swan_ one-shot in 2004.
**Hatsumi Kouichi** is a Japanese director, character designer, animation director, episode director and storyboard artist.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/luisa.viotti/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/viottiluisa) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/luisaviottimaia) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@luisaviotti1887) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/FalaCritica) | [IMDb](https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3179798)

Luísa Viotti Maia is a Brazilian actress, voice actress, singer, dubbing director, and streamer.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Jules Vaughn (Euphoria)
- Jessie Buckley, Vanessa Kirby, Jessica Rothe and Lore Graniewicz (Most of the productions)
- Elaine Benes (1st voice - 1st-4th season; Seinfield)
- Yennefer of Vengerberg (The Witcher)
- Maria Santiago (The Loud House and The Casagrandes)
- Zoé Lee (Miraculous: Les aventures de Ladybug et Chat Noir)
- Kay Challis / Crazy Jane (Doom Patrol)
- Bunty (Disenchantment)
- Josie McCoy (Riverdale)
- Angela Childs (Kimi)
- Beast Girl (Teen Titans Go!)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/thereubeh)

Manager, Netflix Originals at SDI Media.
Clint Bickham is an American voice actor and ADR script writer working with Funimation Entertainment/OkraTron 5000 and ADV Films/Seraphim Digital.

[Website](https://higedan.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/officialhige) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/officialhigedandism) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/officialhigedandism/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3vg17IZ1IV73xx069jG44w) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5Vo1hnCRmCM6M4thZCInCj)

__Official Hige Dandism__ (Official髭男dism, stylized as Official HIGE DANdism), commonly abbreviated __Higedan__ (ヒゲダン), is a Japanese pop band formed in Shimane, Japan in 2012.

After signing a record deal with the major label Pony Canyon in 2018, Official Hige Dandism released the debut single _"No Doubt"_, the lead single from the extended play, Stand by You EP. The following year, the band released the second single, _"Pretender"_, which ranked at number three on the year-end chart of Billboard Japan Hot 100 in 2019. Their debut studio album Traveler was released on 9 October 2019 and reached number one on the Japan Albums Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members:__
• [Satoshi Fujihara](https://anilist.co/staff/277082) (藤原聡) - born August 19, 1991 (lead vocals, piano)
• Daisuke Ozasa (小笹大輔) - born January 6, 1994 (lead guitar, backing vocals)
• Makoto Narazaki (楢﨑誠) - born March 18, 1989 (bass, saxophone, backing vocals)
• Masaki Matsuura (松浦匡希) - born January 22, 1993 (drums, percussion, backing vocals)

[Website](https://higedan.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/officialhige) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/officialhigedandism) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/officialhigedandism/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3vg17IZ1IV73xx069jG44w) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5Vo1hnCRmCM6M4thZCInCj)

__Official Hige Dandism__ (Official髭男dism, stylized as Official HIGE DANdism), commonly abbreviated __Higedan__ (ヒゲダン), is a Japanese pop band formed in Shimane, Japan in 2012.

After signing a record deal with the major label Pony Canyon in 2018, Official Hige Dandism released the debut single _"No Doubt"_, the lead single from the extended play, Stand by You EP. The following year, the band released the second single, _"Pretender"_, which ranked at number three on the year-end chart of Billboard Japan Hot 100 in 2019. Their debut studio album Traveler was released on 9 October 2019 and reached number one on the Japan Albums Chart.
